ygData.subject: RE: A Request and Thoughts on Rubicite Armor.
ygData.msgSnippet: No one under 40 should go against the lord, and really should all be 45 to 50.  the only way 6 ppl can do it is with one tank, 2 clerics, a wizard, another
ygData.messageBody:
No one under 40 should go against the lord, and really should all be 45 to
50. the only way 6 ppl can do it is with one tank, 2 clerics, a wizard,
another tank or bard, plus an ENCHANTER. the enchanter has to mes the 2
boks so you can concentrate on the lord. the lord is level 47 or 48, but
has about 10000hp and TWO Harm Touches about 480dmg each, and double attacks
for 112+. so if you have no enchanter, you need about 12 people. The 2
cleric rule is so one can constantly rotate their 3 or 4 stun spells on him,
while the other heals. The only way to pull singly is a level 50 monk who
knows how to pull using feign death. Only tried that once but it worked.
Otherwise, need around 12 ppl or 6 or more plus enchanter, preferrably all
level 45 to 50.

Shada

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Tim and Mary Steed [mailto:timandmary@...]
> Sent: Monday, July 26, 1999 3:49 AM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] A Request and Thoughts on Rubicite Armor.
>
>
> From: "Tim and Mary Steed" <timandmary@...>
>
> Michael (or anyone else),
>
> Ok, need some advice on the Ghoul Lord.
>
> Our Guild, pretty much nightly, has 6 people levels 35-49
> head down and
> clear the whole area UP TO The Ghoul Lord. By the time we
> reach him, all
> that is left is 2 Bok Knights, The Ghoul Lord, and his pet.
>
> Just HOW TOUGH is the Ghoul Lord? Is there another critter he can be
> equally compared to? How about the Bok Knights? Any
> suggestions? Can the
> Boks be pulled singly?
>
> Thanks for any input,
>
> Tallonn - 36th Verse
> Bertox
